channel.title: Loading bar for 317 pi
channel.description:
Hello community,It is me again :)
Base: "project insanity 317 pi"
I searched 2 hours on google and other forums but didn`t found anything about loading bars for "317 pi" or "project insanity". So now i am wondering who can help me to do this.
[IMG]http://i59.tinypic.com/5noj2d.png[/img]
I have the sprites so that is no problem. Please don`t come with the solution galkons refactored loading bar, becuz that gave me 100errors
Peace

item.title: Loading bar for 317 pi
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“TheGodzGang, post:5, topic:545200”]That doesnt work becuz i dont have a galkons refactored client,
I have a project insanity client so the methodes gives me errors… look on the end of my topic.
I said: “Please don`t come with the solution galkons refactored loading bar, becuz that gave me 100errors” But still thanks.[/quote]

First, there is no such thing as a “Project insanity client”. Never has been. Project Insanity is a server.

Second, “100 errors” typically means you missed a brace (the curly parenthesis, { } ). Please note I did not say it always is that, as there are other ways to cause the 100 errors. (Java’s compiler only shows, at max, 100 errors)

Third, convert it to your code. Look at the code given to you and your current code, replace names that don’t match.

Example:

Say in the tutorial there’s a boolean named “aBoolean889”.
However, in my client there is no such thing.

Tutorial code:

public void someVoid(int anInt01, anInt02) { if(aBoolean889) System.out.println("Yay it's true"); }

My code:

public void someVoid(int anInt01, anInt02) { if(playerIsOnline) System.out.println("Yay it's true"); }

I would use my great detective skills to see that the boolean “aBoolean889” does the exact same thing as the boolean “playerIsOnline”. That would mean anytime I saw “aBoolean889” in the tutorial I would now know to rename any instance of it to “playerIsOnline”.

Read full topic
